newsitem.title: FRANCE: Euro Disney expects profit for 1995/96.
newsitem.headline: Euro Disney expects profit for 1995/96.

text.p: Euro Disney chairman Philippe Bourguignon said in a newspaper interview published Monday that he expected the theme park operator to show an annual profit for the year ending on Sept. 30.
"We had predicted break-even for this year and we reached that goal a year ahead of schedule (in 1994/95)," he told Le Figaro. "We should logically do better this year."
He said the summer had been "satisfying," with a rebound in visitors from Germany. Attendance during the low winter months had also increased.
"Our occupancy rate now during the low season is higher than the occupancy rate for the whole of 1993," Bourguignon said.
Euro Disney reported a net profit of 114 million francs ($22.5 million) for 1994/95, including a 112 million franc ($22.1 million) extraordinary gain from the repurchase of convertible bonds.
Bourguignon said analysts estimate the company will show a net profit for 1995/96 of between 150 million and 220 million francs ($29.5 million and $43.3 milllion).
